website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering if you want a basic model that displays speed and a handy compass in spite of a few known issues.
pros: Affordable and practical - provides speed readings in miles per hour or kilometers per hour and compass
Windshield display brightness level adjusts with light sensors
Auto on and off when you power up or shut down your car
cons: Requires calibration, which can be confusing
Display is hard to see in very bright light
Some lag in the readings has been noted

customer_reviews.title: Perfect HUD
customer_reviews.text: I had another product but all the other information was just distracting. This is perfect and just what I really wanted. Its easy to see even with out anything on the windshield and in direct sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: BILL SOUTHARD

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, works great, pretty accurate, really makes driving even more fun.
customer_reviews.author: lalalalala

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few months
customer_reviews.text: It was cool while it worked... It began only intermittently working after a few months of use until it finally wouldn't power on at all. Was reasonably accurate relative to my car's speedometer gauge when it worked.
customer_reviews.author: stingray

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I plugged this thing in alongside another HUD i bought from AutoZone at roughly the same price and this one was so laggy i didn’t even use it for more than one test drive. Horrible for what i paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Improves your speed control
customer_reviews.text: This is so much easier than looking at the dial. There is a little discrepancy when you get around 60 mph, it reads at 64. If it saves me getting a ticket, that is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Renee J

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be doing its job without complaint. I'll like it better once the power cord is out of sight and frees up the cigarette-lighter socket.
customer_reviews.author: F. Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is great adjustable brightness easy to use and see
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Corvette action make sure to wear headphones!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works well. The only thing is that its a little slow to catch up on the speed but $40 bucks is a good price for the heads up display. 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Perez

customer_reviews.title: Does just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Does just what I wanted. Provides an accurate easy to read real time update of you speed. No longer any reason to take eyes off road, squint, and try to find the in dash speedometer to see how fast I'm going.
customer_reviews.author: DKP

customer_reviews.title: Display
customer_reviews.text: Display is good however I can’t figure how you change from miles to kilometres as it does not say in manual leaflet
customer_reviews.author: hugh67

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, highly visible in my vehicle without the added reflector screen.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: GPS HUD Speedometer.
customer_reviews.text: First day of use and I’m completely surprised with it. It’s accurate to within 1 mph or less at all times when compared against my car speedo. On acceleration, the lag is negligible by a second or so. Completely reasonable operations. I’ve tested it up to 70 mph. I’m really happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: J P

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: After I had finally figured out how to adjust the speed on this it has worked great, can see it clearly during the night and day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great product with heads up display
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to hook up saved me from tearing the dash apart and the heads up display was nice and clear
customer_reviews.author: Kris Owen

customer_reviews.title: Works good at night
customer_reviews.text: Works good at night. Not worth a crap in daylight. Cannot see the reflection. If it's a bright sunny day or wearing sunglasses, forget it. Going to look for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W.

customer_reviews.title: Works well. The compass letters could be a little ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well. The compass letters could be a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace broken speedometer and it's been working great
customer_reviews.author: Bunny Mom

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my antique car
customer_reviews.text: I have an original condition 1930 Chevy Coupe. The speedometer cable broke, and I couldn't locate a replacement. So I installed this on the dash. I use a 12-volt lantern battery to power it as my Chevy has a 6-volt system. So now when I'm traveling through a 25 mph speed zone, I can avoid getting a speeding ticket. Anything above a 25 mph speed limit, I'm okay without a speedometer.
customer_reviews.author: M.Reed

customer_reviews.title: at 75MPH this HUD reads 80MPH
customer_reviews.text: Three devices: Car, hand held GPS and Phone Google Maps all show 75MPH, this device reads 80MPH. Out in West Texas and my hand Held GPS was locked with at least TEN! satellites (attached photo). The speed read out on the HUD was not stable, bounced around by few MPH. I did calibration thing changing 107 to 102 - nothing, still 80. Don't have to mess with this - Refund dude??
customer_reviews.author: MidlandBob

customer_reviews.title: Decent but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Unit works, but not very accurate. Running side by side to my Garmin GPS unit, at 75 mph the Pyle was 4 mph faster. Lag time is significantly more present in the Pyle vs the Garmin. Lower speeds was 1-2 mph faster. Not terrible but what can you expect for 35$.
customer_reviews.author: Cody L.

customer_reviews.title: but it works fine for speed
customer_reviews.text: The NEWS directions are almost impossible to read, but it works fine for speed. It's hard to adjust, but once adjusted, it seems to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: TCZ

customer_reviews.title: Speedometer works fine.
customer_reviews.text: The speed display works fine but the compass indicators are far to small to be visible at the distance of the windshield. I am keeping the device for the speed display because my installed speedometer is not conveniently located and is difficult to read. There are several cellphone apps with similar function.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Something so simple should be easy to setup and calibrate
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are poorly written and calibrating it should be much simpler. I used the device for a 500 mile road trip and the latency is annoying. I have a very accurate Garmin navigation device that I used for comparison. I will not buy another PYLE product.
customer_reviews.author: Timmy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for Price
customer_reviews.text: The PHUD 12 is compact and very user friendly. The display is bright and easy to read without the windshield film. I am definitely glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the cost
customer_reviews.text: I'm liking this a lot. The compass is awesome. The speed seems to need a few seconds to get accurate, but does get there. Super easy to install and ready to use. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: heidi solterman

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter's new car because her old one had a digital compass that she got used to using. She loves it and it helps her find her way home!
customer_reviews.author: Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not good as a compass, Direction is too small. but good heads up display for speed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super HUD
customer_reviews.text: I have sent back other units, this works right out of the box.....didn’t even have to set it up
customer_reviews.author: Don G

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: This device solved a problem for me with my old pickup truck. The speedometer reads 15 mph faster than reality. The HUD display was an economical fix. It is easy to see my vehicle speed. It also provides compass directions, a significant benefit to me.
customer_reviews.author: myrtin

customer_reviews.title: I like to use it standing up vertical
customer_reviews.text: I did not use the reflecting screen. I like to use it standing up vertical. It is very bright and very accurate, both in speed and direction. The power cord is very long to accommodate every dash board.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence P. Baldasare

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: After having it for three weeks it actually works a lot better. When I first got it after passing 50mph now it works on point passing 80
customer_reviews.author: Herbert

customer_reviews.title: plug and go and ease of reading.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the just plug in and go. easy and clear to read
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: I actually used the product and am happy to report that it is excellent right out of the box. It quickly catches the satellite and the calculated speed is very accurate. Also the HUD display is clear, easy to read and brilliant. The base for the unit is solid and it stays put on the dash and doesn't slide around as you driving. Overall, great value at this price point!
customer_reviews.author: thegoodsense

customer_reviews.title: Run fast
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk... we couldn’t get it to work at all.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: customer service on pyles products
customer_reviews.text: terrible customer service--after 90 days of use. product failed, and was unable to get satisfactory service on mgf. warranty. buy at risk
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No MPH
customer_reviews.text: Does not "feely" change from KPH to MPH as it insists on keeping the KPH reading. Instructions are horrible: poor English and missing specifics. The compass function is quite general, with little "definition:" NSEW; not terribly helpful unless one is driving the waffle iron roads of the Midwest, where it is very hard to get lost anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Hatfield
